go_data.justification: CMTM6 is an uncharacterised protein localised at the cell surface.
CMTM6 was immunoprecipitated from digitonin lysates of IFN-gamma treated cells and subjected to mass spectrometry analysis, identifying PD-L1 as a top ranked interacting protein.
CMTM6 functions as a key regulator of T-lymphocyte mediated anti-tumour immunity by modulating cell surface expression of PD-L1.
The physical association between CMTM6 and PD-L1, and the effect of CMTM6 depletion on T-cell responses, indicate involvement in cell surface receptor signaling.
